column6: Description
This schema represents the header of a data transaction.
column13: |1|header.$schema|OMH to FHIR  Provenance Profile|see Provenance elements below|

column6: URI for the schema
schema title
schema description

column12: fixed to "#" since  Provenance  is contained in Observation
column13: ||None|target.reference|fixed to "#" since  Provenance  is contained in Observation|

column12: System provided value indicates the instant the omh message was transformed to a FHIR resource.
column13: ||None|recorded|System provided value indicates the instant the omh message was transformed to a FHIR resource.|

column12: fixed to "http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/ImplementationGuide/openmhealth.mfhir-0.0.0" Provenance.policy can optionally point to the  omh-fhir ig rules url used for the transformation
column13: ||None|policy|fixed to "http://www.fhir.org/guides/mfhir/ImplementationGuide/openmhealth.mfhir-0.0.0" Provenance.policy can optionally point to the  omh-fhir ig rules url used for the transformation|

column12: Provenance.agent.who references the Organization or Device performing the transformation.
column13: ||None|agent[0].type.who.reference|Provenance.agent.who references the Organization or Device performing the transformation.|

column12: Provenance.entity is optional.  see entity elements below
column13: ||None|entity[0]|Provenance.entity is optional.  see entity elements below|

column6: The identifier of this data point: a globally unique value, generated using RFC 4122 approach.(https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4122)
The schema identifier of the body of the data point or data series.
The namespace of the schema. A namespace serves to disambiguate schemas with conflicting names.
The name of the schema.
The version of the schema, e.g. 1.0.

The date time (timestamp) when this datapoint or data series was created at the original source. If the datapoint or data series is aggregated later, the date does not change. If the datapoint or data series is recalculated later (e.g., using a different algorithm), a new datapoint or data series is created with a different id and creation date. This represents a point in time (ISO8601). If a timezone is not included, the timezone is assumed to be UTC. Reference RFC 3339 5.6 for details.", "url": "http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6.
['sensed' ,'self-reported'] The modality whereby the measure is obtained, e.g., sensed or self-reported.
The rate at which measures are acquired. Choice of Unit of Measure and Value  OR How many times the event occurs or should occur in the time window.
The numeric value
The lower boundary  in the interval.
The upper boundary in the interval.
IF 'value' valued then unit = 'hz' ELSE unit = ["ps","ns","us","ms","sec","min","h","d","wk","Mo","yr"].The unit of measure of the element. Allowed values are drawn from UCUM.

Reference(s) to external documentation regarding the component(s) relevant to describe the collection, computation, use, etc. of this datapoint or data series, e.g., software, algorithm, study protocol, etc.
The type of component described or documented by the referenced datasheet, e.g., software, hardware, study.
International Resource Identifier (IRI) of applicable datasheet(s). The expectation is that the IRI will convey resolvable location and access information for the resource identified resource.
